intro: Avenastrum quinquesetum, commonly known as the five-leafed wormwood, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flower heads that are clustered in flat-topped inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in dry, rocky soils. Avenastrum quinquesetum is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens.
